executive_summary: The Fertilizer Manufacturing industry produces fertilizer containing nitrogen, phosphorous or potassium for crops that produce food, feed, fiber and energy. It is a commodity industry with high volatility due to global market pricing. Over the past five years, the industry experienced heightened volatility from input prices, COVID-19, and the Ukraine war, with fertilizer prices rising significantly in 2021-2022. Industry revenue is expected to rise 7.3% annually to $27.2 billion over the past five years, including 14.0% in 2022 alone. Industry profit is projected at 6.9% of revenue in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: US Farmers Grow More Crops and Help Grow the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Crop production has increased over the past five years, increasing demand and production of fertilizer manufacturing to aid crop production, benefitting the industry. Farmers have also seen higher prices for agricultural products, spurring fertilizer demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Volatility in Raw Material Prices Sends the Industry Soaring
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The price of natural gas, the main raw material for nitrogen fertilizer production, has increased, with the cost increase passed onto buyers as higher prices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Fertilizer Manufacturing Industry is Highly Globalized
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The price of corn has skyrocketed following the pandemic recovery and Ukraine war, boosting fertilizer demand as corn requires plentiful fertilizer. Exports are significant, with US manufacturers increasing production to fill the void from sanctions on Russian exports. A stronger US dollar has made US goods more expensive for foreign trade partners.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Costs and Prices Rise for Downstream Markets Resulting in Pricing Pressure for Industry Operators
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Fertilizer prices are expected to rise, increasing costs for farmers who may plant more crops requiring less fertilizer, putting downward pressure on industry revenue. The Ukraine war is expected to contribute to rising fertilizer prices initially due to reduced global exports from Russia and Ukraine.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Reduction of Imports Will Result in Greater Demand for US Fertilizer Manufacturers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: An expected decline in the US dollar's strength over the next five years will decrease import satisfaction of domestic demand, resulting in more demand for US-based fertilizer manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Global Developments and Investment in the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The USDA announced a $250 million investment to support US fertilizer manufacturers and provide more choices for farmers, beginning distribution in late 2022. The Biden administration also made $500 million available to increase fertilizer production and reduce price hikes from the Ukraine conflict.

industry_definition: This industry primarily manufactures fertilizer products containing a mixture of the three vital plant growth nutrients: nitrogen, phosphorous and potassium. The products are distributed via wholesale arrangements or by the vertically integrated manufacturer.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - increasing

threats: Oil and natural gas price index

key_trends: Fertilizer prices are experiencing volatility due to the Russia-Ukraine war, the rise in natural gas prices and the lasting effects of the pandemic.
Fertilizer is a commodity, meaning that global trade and the world market determines prices.

Operators to upgrade facilities to meet greater environmental regulations and standards. Federal and state laws regarding the industry ensure that operators conduct business appropriately and protect the environment.
Operators receive assistance from the USDA due to the pandemic, allowing the industry to bounce back and ease supply chain issues.
Nitrogenous fertilizers are the most used fertilizers by US farmers but increased imports have reduced domestic production.
Battered supply chains and high transportation costs have resulted in farmers raising crop prices.
Regions that are large agricultural producers attract a substantial amount of fertilizer manufactures.
Fertilizer manufacturers huddle around regions that offer a wide variety of fruits and vegetables and have good weather.
The perfect blend of fertilizers is crucial. Farmers need the right amount of nitrogen and phosphate levels in their fertilizer mix to grow their crops effectively and efficiently.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Corn farmers remain the largest market for the Fertilizer Manufacturing industry. Corn prices have risen over the current period as the pandemic has battered supply chains for corn farmers.
With the ongoing war in Ukraine, fertilizer exports in the US are expected to remain high and increase as a share of revenue over the next five years.

This market is comprised of all other consumers of fertilizers, including potato farmers, tomato farmers, tobacco farmers and exports. Other commercial industries that use fertilizers are golf courses, landscapers and nurseries.
Soybean farmers are the third-largest market for the Fertilizer Manufacturing industry. Farmers have planted more soybeans in recent years since they are more cost-effective compared to other crops.

Wheat prices have followed a similar trend to those of corn. The price of wheat has risen over the past five years, rising exponentially in 2021 as supply chain disruptions and high transportation costs were passed on to the consumer.
Cotton farmers make up the smallest market of fertilizer consumption. Demand from cotton farming has decreased over the past five years, placing downward pressure on the market segment.

products_and_services.product_description: Nitrogenous fertilizer production is based on the manufacturing of ammonia, which is used as an essential raw input for various granulated fertilizers like urea, ammonium nitrate and liquid fertilizers.

Phosphate fertilizers are manufactured by adding acid to ground phosphate rock, while superphosphates are manufactured by treating phosphate rock with sulfuric acid and water, rendering the phosphorus into a soluble form that plants can absorb.
Fertilizer mix is a combination of fertilizers which support plant growth.

tier_1_suppliers: Oil Drilling & Gas Extraction in the US
Mineral & Phosphate Mining in the US
Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Plastic Film, Sheet & Bag Manufacturing in the US
Plastic Pipe & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Laminated Plastics Manufacturing in the US
Polystyrene Foam Manufacturing in the US
Urethane Foam Manufacturing in the US
Plastic Bottle Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Paper Bag & Disposable Plastic Product Wholesaling in the US
Bottled Water Production in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Competition from global players is intense
demand_determinants.determinant_description: European and Asian manufacturers have highly competitive facilities and also locate near North American entry points such as the Gulf Coast and the East Coast.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Volatile energy prices escalate pricing pressure
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Operators must navigate through volatile input costs and keep their products price competitive.

The agricultural price index measures the amount farmers receive for crop sales. Changes in commodity prices can affect agricultural production and prices. When farming income increases, farmers typically spend more on fertilizer.

Crop production patterns play a significant role in influencing demand for various fertilizer products, which are influenced by crop prices. An increase in crop production will likely raise demand for fertilizer.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Oil and Natural Gas Price Index
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Natural gas is the main raw material used to produce nitrogen fertilizer. As the price of natural gas rises, the cost of manufacturing nitrogen fertilizer also rises.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports of fertilizers grow to record level
international_trade_points.trade_description: Canada is a valuable trading partner and the leading country of fertilizer imports into the United States. Imports will grow over the five years to 2023, led by increased imports from Canada.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Strong US dollar allows for more imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: The US dollar has increased during the current period, making it cheaper to import fertilizer.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports of fertilizer surge as war breaks out in Europe
international_trade_points.trade_description: The US has increased exports of fertilizer since the breakout of the war in Ukraine. The sanctions placed on Russia have limited the country's export of fertilizer, creating a void which US companies have helped fill.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports are crucial for the industry
international_trade_points.trade_description: With the ongoing war in Ukraine, fertilizer exports in the US are expected to remain high and increase as a share of revenue over the next five years.

business_locations.location_description: The majority of industry establishments are located in the Southeast, with Florida holding the largest concentration compared to other states across the country. The Southeast region is a significant agricultural producer.

In the West, California has the largest amount of industry operators. California is also the largest agricultural producer in the Unites States, so industry operators benefit from farmers and downstream markets in the state.
The Mid-Atlantic accounts for the third-largest amount of industry operators across the country. The region grows a diverse variety of fruits and vegetables.

regulations_points.regulation_description: While regulated predominantly at a state level, some federal laws apply to fertilizer manufacturing. These laws include the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act and transportation and storage guidelines.

Each state has its own fertilizer regulatory program that is typically administered by the relevant state department of agriculture. State regulators are concerned with issues such as the proper handling of fertilizers, labeling and the protection of human health, the environment and consumers.

The Association of American Plant Food Control Officials is the national organization of fertilizer control officials from each state. These officials are responsible for administering fertilizer regulations and providing consumer protection.

basis_points.basis_description: The perfect blend of fertilizers is crucial. Farmers need the right amount of nitrogen and phosphate levels in their fertilizer mix to grow their crops effectively and efficiently.

Competition from global players is intense. European and Asian manufacturers have highly competitive facilities and also locate near North American entry points such as the Gulf Coast and the East Coast.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Fertilizer Manufacturing industry has experienced significant growth over the last five years. As a result, there has been an influx of new players in an attempt to capture share in the growing market.
Smaller players produce products for specific geographical regions or niche segments in order to compete in the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Mergers and acquisitions by major players
concentration_points.concentration_description: Major players in the industry set out to acquire or merge with competitors to help with growing their business and presence in the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Nutrien formed by Agrium and Potash Corp merger
concentration_points.concentration_description: In 2018, Agrium and Potash Corp. merged into the newly formed Nutrien. Nutrien is the third-largest player in the industry and accounts for over 10.0% of industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases Jump as the Pandemic and the Ukraine War Increase the Price of Raw Materials
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases include raw materials such as phosphate rock, elemental sulfur, sulfuric acid, ammonia and more. Due to the pandemic and the ongoing war in Ukraine, the cost of acquiring materials has risen in the latter part of the period.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Miscellaneous Costs Include Compliance Costs Regarding Environmental Laws and Regulations
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry is also subject to an array of environmental laws and regulations, which have implications for its cost structure. In recent years, compliance costs have risen due to increased scrutiny by the Environmental Protection Agency.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit is Influenced by the Price of Key Fertilizers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profitability is influenced by a variety of variables, such as the price of key fertilizers, input costs investment costs, transportation costs and distribution and energy costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES REMAIN RELATIVELY STEADY OVER THE PAST FIVE YEARS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Total wage expenses are estimated to account for 8.6% of revenue in 2023. Wage expenses have remained relatively steady over the five years to 2023 even though wage growth outpaced revenue growth during the same period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: A significant amount of capital is required to operate a fertilizer manufacturing plant. New facilities can cost hundreds of millions of dollars, while upgrades to ensure competitiveness or economies of scale also require large investment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: External factors like the pandemic impact revenue volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry participants are subject to several external market factors outside of their control. For example, agricultural incomes, a key demand determinant, can be highly volatile as they are susceptible to changes in climatic conditions and commodity prices.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Price Volatility Has Affected Revenue Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Determined by global demand and supply forces, fertilizer prices can also fluctuate substantially, adding to the volatility of the industry. Over the five years to 2023, there have been drastic changes in crop and fertilizer prices.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations. However, a low rate of growth in technology can also create exposure for incumbents as the trajectory of innovation in other markets could lead to unforeseen competitive disadvantages.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising import penetration has negatively affected demand for the industry's products. However, nitrogen and Urea manufacturing has generally been a net importer commodity.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Sales are heavily dependent on the health of the US agricultural sector which in turn is dependent on international demand.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Input prices have experienced significant volatility, especially since the advent of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and the war in Ukraine.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Major operators in the industry have setup manufacturing facilities abroad.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs have slightly risen as a share of revenue despite an increase in technology over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Do you use SAP software systems to optimize all aspects of your company's manufacturing, sales, inventory and distribution channels?
FAQs.answer: Major companies in the industry have robust infrastructure in place in terms of wholesale and retail distribution of fertilizers.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulatory expenses have remained constant over the past five years in this industry. So these expenses have not significantly impacted profitability.

FAQs.question: Have international tariffs impacted your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: There are no specific tariffs of trade on industry products.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profitability is similar across the industry as it is heavily dependent on agricultural demand.

FAQs.question: How often does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Capital expenditure forms a large part of capital requirements for both small and large operators in the industry. Depending on the nature of demand, equipment is purchased.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure a reliable supply of key inputs? How can you secure supply contracts for inputs such as natural gas?
FAQs.answer: A guaranteed supply of key inputs, such as natural gas, can facilitate year-round production and a competitive advantage. Supply contracts can be secured by entering in a long-term contract at a fixed price which can be beneficial if input price increases.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue do you invest in technology? How quickly do you adopt new technology?
FAQs.answer: Access to the latest available and most efficient technology and techniques. Access to the latest technology can lower manufacturing costs and enable companies to produce higher-quality products for the market, increasing competition among producers.

FAQs.question: How has your company increased economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Increasing price competition from domestic and imported products has heightened the need to generate economies of scale.

FAQs.question: Have you engaged in any M&A activity to help increase your economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Companies do enter M&A deals to increase their production and also expand their portfolio into different products.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the agricultural price index? How have trends in the agricultural price index affected your revenue?
FAQs.answer: The agricultural price index measures the amount farmers receive for crop sales. Changes in commodity prices can affect agricultural production and prices. In particular, global crop prices for grains and oilseeds influence agricultural incomes and planting patterns. When farming income increases, farmers typically spend more on fertilizer.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor changes in the trade-weighted index? How has your company been influenced by a strengthening US dollar?
FAQs.answer: Imports satisfy a large proportion of domestic demand for certain fertilizers, including nitrogen and potash. A stronger US dollar would urge consumers to opt for more affordable, imported fertilizers, thus damaging industry profit margins.

FAQs.question: How has crop production trended in recent years? For which crops does your company produce fertilizer?
FAQs.answer: Crop production patterns play a significant role in influencing demand for various fertilizer products, which are influenced by crop prices. An increase in crop production raises demand for fertilizer. Crop production has increased over the years, due increase in population and demand from hospitality and entertainment industry.
